s.text: Genomic and expression data suggest that the purpose of Asw is titration of Hint function.

One might expect a Hint-Asw heterodimer to have substantially less than 50% of the activity of a Hint homodimer if Hint homodimers showed cooperativity with respect to substrate binding and/or hydrolysis.

While ZZZ triploids seemed like normal males that produced abnormal sperm, ZZW animals appeared female on hatching and then developed some male gonadal and behavioral characteristics as they matured [ 20].

While ZZZ triploids seemed like normal males that produced abnormal sperm, ZZW animals appeared female on hatching and then developed some male gonadal and behavioral characteristics as they matured [ 20].

This analysis suggested: first, that Hint and Asw do retain sufficient sequence identity at the dimer interface to form a heterodimer; second, that Asw has an insertion sequence at the bottom of the dimer that could be a site of alternative localization or proteolysis; and third, that Gln127, a residue that Asw has substituted for Trp123 of Hint, may interfere with the function of His114 in Hint across the dimer interface.

Apart from the curious substitution of 15 of 16 nucleotide-proximal residues in Asw, the most dissimilar region of Asw consists of a five amino-acid insertion between strands ?1 and ?2 and substitution of Gly-Ala-Pro (Asw) for Asp-Glu-Ser (Hint) at the amino-terminal end of helix ?2.
